intro: Agrostis alba var. maritima, commonly known as sea bentgrass, is a coastal grass species native to the northern hemisphere. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils along shorelines and is well adapted to salt spray and wind. The plant has slender,丛生 (clump-forming) growth habit with narrow, grass-like leaves. Its flowers are small and spike-like, typically appearing in late summer. It plays an important ecological role in stabilizing dunes and providing habitat for coastal wildlife.
